    • Method Detail

      • isInteger

        public static int[] isInteger(java.lang.String input)
        Method for checking if a given String contains a Double.
        Parameters:
        input - String to be examined.
        Returns:
        Integer: "1" if input contains an integer, else: "0". The second int in the array is the integer found in the input, if applicable.

      • fixBoolean

        public static java.lang.String fixBoolean(java.lang.String input)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method for conforming an input to a boolean String format. It will return the last boolean compatible substring in the input as 'true' or 'false'.
        Parameters:
        input - The String to transform to a boolean compatible String ('true' or 'false').
        Returns:
        The transformed boolean compatible String ('true' or 'false').
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the String input could not be transformed to a boolean compatible String.

      • isLongitude

        public static boolean isLongitude(java.lang.String longitude)
        Method for checking if a given String contains a longitude value.
        Parameters:
        longitude - String to be examined.
        Returns:
        True if the input longitude is valid.

      • isLatitude

        public static boolean isLatitude(java.lang.String latitude)
        Method for checking if a given String contains a latitude value.
        Parameters:
        latitude - String to be examined.
        Returns:
        True if the input latitude is valid.

      • isIP

        public static boolean isIP(java.lang.String input)
        Check that the input String contains four integers 0-255 separated by dots.
        Parameters:
        input - String to be checked.
        Returns:
        Boolean: True if the input contains an IP address.

      • isValidPath

        public static boolean isValidPath(java.lang.String input)
        Method that checks that an input path string is either empty "", or that is starts (but does not end) with a slash "/". Also, sections divided by slashes should not be empty or contain blank space.
        Parameters:
        input - Path string to check.
        Returns:
        True if the path is valid, otherwise false.

      • isValidWorkspace

        public static boolean isValidWorkspace(java.lang.String input)
        Method that checks that an input path string is not empty "", and contains no special characters.
        Parameters:
        input - Path string to check.
        Returns:
        True if the path is valid, otherwise false.

      • isValidAddress

        public static boolean isValidAddress(java.lang.String input)
        Method that checks that an input address string is not empty "", starts with an approved prefix and does not end with a slash "/".
        Parameters:
        input - Path string to check.
        Returns:
        True if the path is valid, otherwise false.

      • isValidDate

        public static boolean isValidDate(java.lang.String date,
                  java.text.DateFormat dateformat)
        Checks if the supplied string is a valid date.
        Parameters:
        date - The date String to check.
        dateformat - The format of the date to compare to.
        Returns:
        True if the date fits the format.

      • dropColons

        public static java.lang.String dropColons(java.lang.String colonized,
                          int returnMode)
        Drops all the colon characters from the input string.
        Parameters:
        colonized - String containing colon characters.
        returnMode - Which part of the input String to return.
        Returns:
        String without colon characters.

      • copyOfRange_char

        public static char[] copyOfRange_char(char[] original,
                      int start,
                      int length)
        Gets a subset of elements from an array contained in the specified range.
        Parameters:
        original - Original array from which to get a subset.
        start - Start of the new array, inclusive.
        length - The number of elements to fetch.
        Returns:
        A new copy of a subset of elements from the original array.

      • WGS84toGoogle

        public static double[] WGS84toGoogle(double lat,
                     double lon)
        Converts coordinates in degrees lat/lon (WGS84) to metres x/y (Spherical Mercator) used by e.g. GoogleMaps.
        Parameters:
        lat - The latitude to project to y values.
        lon - The longitude to project to x values.
        Returns:
        A (double) array with the projected x/y pair of the GoogleMaps projection.

      • GoogletoWGS84

        public static double[] GoogletoWGS84(double x,
                     double y)
        Converts coordinates in metres x/y (Spherical Mercator) used by e.g. GoogleMaps to degrees lat/lon (WGS84).
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate to project to longitude.
        y - The y coordinate to project to latitude.
        Returns:
        A (double) array with the projected lon/lat pair of the GoogleMaps projection.

      • latLngBoundsToString

        public static java.lang.String latLngBoundsToString(com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLngBounds bounds)
        Returns the provided LatLngBounds as a String fit to insert into a GetMap request, but coordinates converted to GoogleMaps projection (Pseudo Spherical Mercator).

      • coordinateToString

        public static java.lang.String coordinateToString(double lat,
                                  double lon)
        Returns the provided coordinate as a human-readable String with the format "[Y] N, [X] E".
        Parameters:
        lat - The coordinate's latitude.
        lon - The coordinate's longitude.
        Returns:
        A human-readable String representation of the coordinate.

        Deletes the given file or folder with any sub folders and their files to any depth.

        fileOrDirectory - The file or folder to delete.
